summary: This document is an email chain from August 9, 2019, discussing the medication protocols for two inmates on Psych Observation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The correspondence involves a Chief Pharmacist and concerns whether inmates on Psych Observation should be allowed to self-carry medications like amoxicillin and omeprazole.

persons.name: Gentile
persons.context: Inmate identified by number 71230.054 who is listed as being on Psych Observation at MCC New York on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Ramos
persons.context: Inmate identified by number 85428-054 who is listed as being on Psych Observation at MCC New York on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Psych Observation Status Update
events.description: An email update on August 9, 2019, lists two inmates (Gentile and Ramos) as being on Psych Observation at MCC New York, and a separate email chain discusses medication protocols for such inmates.

locations.description: Address of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, where the Chief Pharmacist is based and where the inmates are held.

keyFacts: The document is dated August 9, 2019, which is the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
It discusses medication protocols for inmates on 'Psych Observation' at MCC New York, indicating a focus on inmate mental health and medication management.
Two inmates, Gentile and Ramos, are specifically listed as being on Psych Observation, though Jeffrey Epstein is not mentioned by name in this excerpt.
The correspondence involves a U.S. Public Health Service Chief Pharmacist, highlighting the medical oversight within the federal prison system.
The document is marked as 'CONFIDENTIAL' and part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files, suggesting it was part of the investigation into Epstein's death.
